newsitem.title: CANADA: Alcan slips ahead of Q1 earnings report.
newsitem.headline: Alcan slips ahead of Q1 earnings report.

text.p: Shares of Alcan Aluminium Ltd slipped on Tuesday, ahead of a first-quarter earnings report expected on Thursday that may be disappointing, analysts said.
On the Toronto Stock Exchange, Alcan was off 0.90 to 44 on volume of more than 470,000 shares.
Analysts said Alcan's share price fell on expectations that first-quarter earnings might be lower than the US$0.53 a share reported in last year's first quarter.
Alcan's earnings could be down mainly because aluminum ingot and fabricated product prices had not increased faster from a year ago, Mallory said.
"It probably is taking a bit longer to pass the prices through to fabricated products, which is where Alcan makes its money," said Manfred Mallory of Research Capital Corp.
Alcan was also hit by broad weakness in aluminum stocks, Mallory said. In New York, Alcoa fell 0.25 to 66.50 today after reporting lower first-quarter net earnings per share.
